BR_text.BRsummary: import paddle.fluid & import onnxruntime  will be core_dump
BR_text.BRdescription: We have a problem, we want to use paddle, and when import onnxruntime and paddle.fluid, it will be core_dump directly, how to work out this problem?

comments_0.comment_text:
Please let us know what is  paddle.fluid and how to install it.
 Thanks.

comments_1.comment_text:
I guess adding "-Bsymbolic" to <denchmark-link:https://github.com/microsoft/onnxruntime/blob/master/cmake/onnxruntime.cmake>https://github.com/microsoft/onnxruntime/blob/master/cmake/onnxruntime.cmake</denchmark-link>
  could solve your problem.

comments_2.comment_text:
I guess adding "-Bsymbolic" to https://github.com/microsoft/onnxruntime/blob/master/cmake/onnxruntime.cmake could solve your problem.
 
 OK，is there some versions have make with adding "-Bsymbolic" ?

comments_3.comment_text:
That's interesting. I can reproduce the bug but I don't know why it crashed.  If Paddle can hide their C++ symbols(like what onnxruntime and onnx does) then the problem will be most likely gone.
 It should related to <denchmark-link:https://github.com/pybind/pybind11/issues/1262>pybind/pybind11#1262</denchmark-link>
 
 I'll downgrade our compiler version to match with Paddle. Let's see what would happen after that.

comments_4.comment_text:
<denchmark-link:https://github.com/faxu>@faxu</denchmark-link>
 ,  downgrade to C++11 may solve this.
